comment: Two ways to say a mapping from metric ` C ` to metric ` D ` is continuous. Theorem 10.1 of [Munkres] p. 127. The second biconditional argument says that for every positive "epsilon" ` y ` there is a positive "delta" ` z ` such that a distance less than delta in ` C ` maps to a distance less than epsilon in ` D ` . (Contributed by NM, 15-May-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Aug-2015.)
